image.altText: A beach with a dune and ocean

props.synopsis: Emergency services have resumed a search for a 28-year-old man's body off the West Coast of South Australia.

title.children: SA Police looking for body of man believed to have been killed by shark

image.altText: Black and white photo of people standing in train carts.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill's Picnic Train Attack is a "harrowing story" about two men opening fire on 1,200 civilians, killing four people. But was it Australia's first terrorist attack or an act of personal vengeance?

title.children: Terrorism or vengeance? Historians re-examine Picnic Train Attack

image.altText: A bus on George Street at Thebarton.

props.synopsis: Police say a fight between two groups on an Adelaide public bus led to three people including a woman with head injuries being taken to hospital, as well as 19 arrests.

title.children: Police arrest 19, including 13yo, after woman injured in SA bus fight

image.altText: Close up of man kneeling in wheat crop holding stems.

props.synopsis: Some regions in South Australia have had the lowest rainfall since records began, according to a preliminary Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) report.

title.children: Food producers battle as parts of South Australia record driest year

image.altText: People in beachside bars watch a sun set over the ocean

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has shared his condolences for Adelaide man Jacob Vennix who died in Bali while on honeymoon. His wife Kimberley Fuller has described him as "the most beautiful human, partner and father".

title.children: Tributes for Adelaide man Jacob Vennix who died on honeymoon in Bali

image.altText: A large shark has dried blood and dull scales, it sits on dry grass, dumped on a farm

props.synopsis: Vicki Matchett is all too familiar with rubbish being dumped outside her rural property south of Adelaide — but when she was passing her farm gate several days ago, she saw what "looked like a shark's fin poking up".

title.children: Shark found dumped outside farm believed to be bronze whaler

image.altText: a baker with a wooden paddle near a traditional wood-fire oven

props.synopsis: Scotch ovens used to be the golden-brown standard in Australia, until commercial bakeries and supermarkets extinguished the flames to shut down the competition. But for the last 100 years, no offer has stopped this team of traditional, long-ferment bakers from firing up.

title.children: Century-old Scotch wood-fired oven keeps traditional slow ferment dough dream alive

image.altText: Jason Gillespie and Glenn McGrath with the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

props.synopsis: At the start of the summer, we asked our readers to vote for their favourite moments in the decades-long cricket rivalry between Australia and India. Here are your top 10.

title.children: From our Head to their Pant, here are your top Australia vs India moments

image.altText: India players Jasprit Bumrah (left) and Rohit Sharma (right) speak to coach Gautam Gambhir on the SCG pitch.

props.synopsis: With Rohit Sharma struggling for runs, India coach Gautam Gambhir fronts the media but refuses to confirm if his captain will be in the XI for the final Border-Gavaskar Test match.

title.children: India to lock in SCG Test XI just before play, with skipper under pressure

image.altText: Novak Djokovic plays saxophone on his racquet

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic dominates Gaël Monfils in Brisbane, recording his 20th-straight victory over the Frenchman in the sport's most lop-sided head-to-head.

title.children: Djokovic plays the same old tune as Monfils succumbs to record-breaking loss

image.altText: A brown snake slithering along the ground in the bush.

props.synopsis: The NSW Poisons Information Centre has received 320 calls for suspected or confirmed snake bites between September 1 and December 20, which is a 35 per cent increase over the number of calls during the same time period in 2023.

title.children: 'We want people to be aware of this': Snake bite calls spike across NSW

image.altText: A still image of body cam footage from the perspective of a soldier, going through an underground bunker with other soldiers.

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces says it sent more than 100 troops into Syria under the cover of darkness, as the "flagship" Iranian-backed facility began to pose an "imminent threat" to Israel.

title.children: IDF says it destroyed Syria underground missile factory before Assad fall

image.altText: Morning Mist, Rock Island Bend

props.synopsis: Photography equipment used by Peter Dombrovskis, who brought images of Tasmania's beauty to the world, has been stolen as police say they're investigating a "series of significant burglaries" in Hobart's southern suburbs.

title.children: Camera equipment that belonged to renowned wilderness photographer stolen

image.altText: A composite image of a man cooking

props.synopsis: Mokhtar Hamdi has turned his hand to cooking for kids in Gaza's refugee camps, searching for whatever ingredients he can find to create meals for vulnerable Palestinians.

title.children: Amid aid shortages in Gaza, a chef is making creative dishes for starving children

image.altText: A Palestinian man stands next to the damage at a tent camp sheltering displaced people, following an Israeli strike.

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it has killed the head of Hamas's security forces in southern Gaza, Hussam Shahwah, in a series of air strikes.

title.children: At least 54 people killed in Gaza strikes that Israel says targeted Hamas official

image.altText: Al Jazeera logo on English and Arabic text.

props.synopsis: Al Jazeera has been accused of biased reporting and incitement in the West Bank, but has hit back accusing the Palestinian Authority of adopting Israeli-style media censorship.

title.children: Palestinian Authority suspends broadcaster Al Jazeera in West Bank

image.altText: Three men smile at the camera. Behind them, a portrait of Donald Trump is visible.

props.synopsis: The world's richest man just helped Donald Trump return to the White House, but Elon Musk isn't just interested in the future of the United States.

title.children: Elon Musk helped Trump take the White House. Now he's turning to Europe

image.altText: An aerial view of archeologists uncovering a long line of dinosaur footprints.

props.synopsis: Researchers say the 166-million-year-old fossilised footprints could be one of the world's biggest dinosaur track sites.

title.children: 'It was so surreal': UK quarry worker uncovers 150-metre 'dinosaur highway'

image.altText: Hadi Nazari was reported missing in the Kosciuszko National Park on Boxing Day

props.synopsis: As the search for Hadi Nazari continues in Kosciuszko National Park, the man’s friends say they have been given hope by the discovery of some of his possessions in the rugged NSW Snowy Mountains.

title.children: Renewed hope for missing hiker as possessions found in dense NSW bushland

image.altText: A group of police officers gather in front of a car park and mutliple police cars.

props.synopsis: It is alleged the man, believed to be in his 30s, pointed a gun at police in the car park of Taree's Manning Base Hospital before being shot.

title.children: Man shot dead by police outside hospital in regional NSW

image.altText: Geminid meteor streaking across the evening sky.

props.synopsis: It's a new year — and that means new astronomy events to look out for. Here's what you can see from Australia in 2025.

title.children: The best space and sky events to watch out for in 2025

image.altText: A police ribbon at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a child's body was found inside a burnt caravan in north-central Victoria late on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Police investigate after child dies in caravan fire in north-central Victoria

image.altText: Completely empty dam with dried out mud

props.synopsis: As landowners a couple of kilometres down the road empty full rain gauges, the Schafers' property in central Queensland is a picture of dry paddocks and low dams.

title.children: Farmers struggle with dry weather, while neighbours have full rain gauges

image.altText: Grey pieces of turtle shell, with missing gaps where lost pieces should be, sitting on a oval shaped plaster.

props.synopsis: A 13-million-year-old species of turtle has been discovered after its fossil sat in a display case at an NT museum for decades. An expert says there could be countless more undiscovered animal fossils in their collection.

title.children: New prehistoric turtle species discovered amid NT museum collection

image.altText: Dr David Rosengren smiles for a portrait indoors.

props.synopsis: In his first sit-down interview, Dr David Rosengren says his biggest challenge as director-general will be accessing the workforce needed to provide safe healthcare services.

title.children: New health boss says Queensland 'has to' meet government's ambulance ramping targets

image.altText: Elderly man with a walking cane seated on a deck watching the sunset over the lake, his wife beside

props.synopsis: Having a dementia village open in his home town means artist Henry Field can transition into care without compromising his feeling of independence.

title.children: Dutch care model changing the way people with dementia live

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding a glass under a running tap, filling it with water

props.synopsis: People in parts of Brisbane, Ipswich and Logan may have noticed an earthy, grassy or musty taste and smell to their tap water this week.

title.children: Noticed tap water in Brisbane tastes funny? Here's why

image.altText: Justin Langer smiles and gives the peace sign to the camera

props.synopsis: The former Australian coach is set to take up a role with the London Spirit in England's The Hundred.

title.children: Justin Langer takes on English coaching role alongside IPL position

image.altText: An older man looks out a car window from inside with his arm resting on the car, he has big teeth showing and is wearing a hat

props.synopsis: Chad Morgan is one of Australian country music's most recognisable pioneers, with his upturned hat, signature smile and country comedy hits. Fans are remembering his long career following his death on New Year's Day.

title.children: Country music icon Chad Morgan dies after 70-year career

image.altText: Robbie Williams performs to adoring crowds during an hour-long free concert at Fed Square.

props.synopsis: The UK pop star has performed in front of an overflowing Federation Square in the CBD, after being gifted a key to the city in honour of his contributions to Melbourne.

title.children: Robbie Williams entertains fans for free after Melbourne honour

image.altText: Aerial picture of a home gutted by fire

props.synopsis: Firefighters are battling more than 60 fires across WA in hot and windy conditions, but an emergency warning for a blaze near Albany in the state's south has been downgraded.

title.children: Dozens of fires burn across hot, windy WA as threat from blaze near Albany eases

image.altText: canned anchovy fillets and slices of baguette on wooden kitchen table.

props.synopsis: How this little fish was once central to the cuisine in the Roman Empire.

title.children: How a fish that was once associated with the poor reach the 'very heights of gastronomic greatness'

image.altText: A large group of South Sea Islander men standing an squatting in front of sugar cane.

props.synopsis: It's been 30 years since Australian South Sea Islanders were recognised as a distinct group, but an exhibition to mark the occasion comes amid accusations of the modern-day slavery of Pacific Islander workers.

title.children: Exhibition recognises South Sea Islanders amid fresh slavery concerns

image.altText: A man and a woman in Victorian clothes stand in the snow.

props.synopsis: At a time when vampires have been well and truly defanged in popular culture, Robert Eggers' resurrection of the iconic Nosferatu is a grisly fairytale that reeks of sex, rancid flesh and 2,000 rats.

title.children: Nosferatu remake is stunning while lacking real bite
